basic.description: This course will allow students to meet the Advocate role's objectives.  They will be able to articulate and apply the determinants of health and disease, principles of health promotion and disease prevention to medical encounters and problems.  Topics include factors that influence health, disease, disability and access to care, opportunities for health promotion and disease prevention, resources for patient care and barriers to access to care and resources, health issues for special populations, principles of health policy, health programs and interventions at the population level, communication to patients about community resources and local examples of community resources.
basic.subject: MEDS
basic.title: Professional Foundations:  Population and Global Health
